meanings.definition: To pass through a membrane or pores
meanings.sent1: The water will transude through the tiny holes in the sponge.
meanings.sent2: Oil can transude through the skin if you touch it for too long.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made the juice transude through the paper cup!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to transude through every action she took.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to transude through the leaves, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.sent1: The syrup will transude from the pancake as it cools down.
meanings.sent2: The wound started to transude pus, indicating an infection.
meanings.sent3: The excitement seemed to transude from the children as they waited for the show to start.
meanings.sent4: His confidence seemed to transude from every word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread seemed to transude through the entire house.
